meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an index
meanings.sent1: The indexical page numbers helped me find the information quickly.
meanings.sent2: The librarian explained the indexical system used in the library.
meanings.sent3: I felt like an indexical detective trying to solve the mystery of the missing book.
meanings.sent4: Her indexical knowledge of the library layout made her the go-to person for directions.
meanings.sent5: The indexical labels on the shelves made organizing the books a breeze.

meanings.definition: Serving as a sign or indication of something
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were an indexical warning of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His sudden silence was an indexical clue that something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The broken umbrella was an indexical reminder of the windy weather.
meanings.sent4: The closed sign on the door was an indexical signal that the store was not open.
meanings.sent5: The indexical footprints in the sand showed that someone had been there before.

meanings.definition: Directly pointing to or referring to something
meanings.sent1: The indexical arrow on the map showed the direction to the nearest restroom.
meanings.sent2: Her indexical gesture towards the bookshelf indicated where the novel was located.
meanings.sent3: The indexical note on the document highlighted the important section to read.
meanings.sent4: His indexical gaze towards the clock revealed his impatience.
meanings.sent5: The indexical signpost pointed travelers towards the scenic route.
